packages.name: nats
packages.description:
## Module Overview

This module provides the capability to connect with NATS server and performs the 
below functionalities.

- Point to point communication (Queues)
- Pub/Sub (Topics)
- Request/Reply

### Basic Usage

#### Setting up the connection

First step is setting up the connection with the NATS Basic server. The following ways can be used to connect to a
NATS Basic server.

1. Connect to a server using the URL
```ballerina
nats:Client natsClient = new("nats://localhost:4222");
```

2. Connect to one or more servers with a custom configuration
```ballerina
nats:Client natsClient = new({"nats://serverone:4222",  "nats://servertwo:4222"},  config);
```

#### Publishing messages

##### Publishing messages to the NATS basic server

Once connected, publishing is accomplished via one of the below two methods.

1. Publish with the subject and the message content.
```ballerina
string message = "hello world";
nats:Error? result = 
    natsClient->publishMessage({ content: message.toBytes(), subject: "demo.nats.basic"});
```

2. Publish as a request that expects a reply.
```ballerina
string message = "hello world";
nats:Message|nats:Error reqReply = 
    natsClient->requestMessage({ content: message.toBytes(), subject: "demo.nats.basic"}, 5000);
```

3. Publish messages with a replyTo subject 
```ballerina
string message = "hello world";
nats:Error? result = natsClient->publish({ content: message.toBytes(), subject: "demo.nats.basic",
                                                    replyTo: "demo.reply" });
```

#### Listening to incoming messages

##### Listening to messages from a NATS server

```ballerina
// Binds the consumer to listen to the messages published to the 'demo' subject.
@nats:ServiceConfig {
    subject: "demo"
}
service demo on new nats:Listener() {

    remote function onMessage(nats:Message msg) {
    }
}
```

>**Note:** The default thread pool size used in Ballerina is the number of processors available * 2. You can configure the thread pool size by using the `BALLERINA_MAX_POOL_SIZE` environment variable.

For information on the operations, which you can perform with this module, see the below **Functions**. 

For examples on the usage of the connector, see the following.
* [Basic Publisher and Subscriber Example](https://ballerina.io/swan-lake/learn/by-example/nats-basic-client.html).
packages.summary:
This module provides the capability to connect with NATS server and performs the
below functionalities.

fields.name: connectionName
fields.description: Name of the connection (this is optional)

fields.name: retryConfig
fields.description: Configurations related to connection reconnect attempts

fields.name: ping
fields.description: Configurations related to pinging the server

fields.name: auth
fields.description: Configurations related to authentication

fields.name: inboxPrefix
fields.description: The connection's inbox prefix, which all inboxes will start with

fields.name: noEcho
fields.description:
Turns off echoing. This prevents the server from echoing messages back to the connection if it
           has subscriptions on the subject being published to

fields.name: secureSocket
fields.description: Configurations related to SSL/TLS

records.name: ConnectionConfig
records.description: Configurations related to creating a NATS streaming subscription.

fields.name: username
fields.description: The username for basic authentication

fields.name: password
fields.description: The password for basic authentication

fields.name: content
fields.description: The message content

fields.name: subject
fields.description: The subject to which the message was sent to

fields.name: replyTo
fields.description: The `replyTo` subject of the message

records.name: Message
records.description: Represents the message, which a NATS server sends to its subscribed services.

fields.name: maxMessages
fields.description:
Maximum number of pending messages retrieved and held by the consumer service.
                The default value is 65536

fields.name: maxBytes
fields.description:
Total size of pending messages in bytes retrieved and held by the consumer service.
             The default value is 67108864

records.name: PendingLimits
records.description:
The configurations to set limits on the maximum number of messages or maximum size of messages this consumer will
hold before it starts to drop new messages waiting for the resource functions to drain the queue.
Setting a value less than or equal to 0 will disable this check.

fields.name: pingIntervalInMinutes
fields.description: The interval (in minutes) between the attempts of pinging the server

fields.name: maxPingsOut
fields.description: The maximum number of pings the client can have in flight. The default value is two

records.name: Ping
records.description: Configurations related to pinging the server

fields.name: maxReconnect
fields.description:
Maximum number of reconnect attempts. The reconnect state is triggered when an already established
                 connection is lost. During the initial connection attempt, the client will cycle
                 over its server list one time regardless of the `maxReconnects` value that is set.
                 Use 0 to turn off auto reconnecting.
                 Use -1 to turn on infinite reconnects.

fields.name: reconnectWaitInSeconds
fields.description: The time(in seconds) to wait between the reconnect attempts to reconnect to the same server

fields.name: connectionTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description: The timeout (in seconds) for the connection attempts

records.name: RetryConfig
records.description: Configurations related to connection reconnect attempts.

fields.name: trustStore
fields.description: Configurations associated with the TrustStore

fields.name: keyStore
fields.description: Configurations associated with the KeyStore

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: The standard name of the requested protocol

records.name: SecureSocket
records.description: Configurations related to facilitating a secure communication with a remote HTTP endpoint.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: Name of the subject

fields.name: queueName
fields.description: Name of the queue group

fields.name: pendingLimits
fields.description:
Parameters to set limits on the maximum number of pending messages
                  or maximum size of pending messages

records.name: ServiceConfigData
records.description: The configurations for the NATS basic subscription.

fields.name: token
fields.description: The token for token-based authentication

records.name: Tokens
records.description: Configurations related to token based authentication.

returnParameters.description: `()` or else a `nats:Error` if there is a problem when publishing the message

remoteMethods.name: publishMessage
remoteMethods.description:
Publishes data to a given subject.
```ballerina
    # nats:Error? result = natsClient->publishMessage(<@untainted>message);
    # ```

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The time (in milliseconds) to wait for the response

returnParameters.description: The `nats:Message` response or else a `nats:Error` if an error is encountered

remoteMethods.name: requestMessage
remoteMethods.description:
Publishes data to a given subject and waits for a response.
```ballerina
    # nats:Message|nats:Error reqReply = natsClient->requestMessage(<@untainted>message);
    # ```

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The NATS Broker URL. For a clustered use case, pass the URLs as a string array

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: Configurations associated with the NATS client to establish a connection with the server

returnParameters.description: `()` or else a `nats:Error` if there is a problem when publishing the message

methods.name: publishMessage
methods.description:
Publishes data to a given subject.
```ballerina
    # nats:Error? result = natsClient->publishMessage(<@untainted>message);
    # ```

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The time (in milliseconds) to wait for the response

returnParameters.description: The `nats:Message` response or else a `nats:Error` if an error is encountered

methods.name: requestMessage
methods.description:
Publishes data to a given subject and waits for a response.
```ballerina
    # nats:Message|nats:Error reqReply = natsClient->requestMessage(<@untainted>message);
    # ```

returnParameters.description: `()` or else a `nats:Error` if unable to complete the close the operation

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The NATS Broker URL. For a clustered use case, pass the URLs as a string array

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: Configurations associated with the NATS client to establish a connection with the server

returnParameters.description: `()` or else a `nats:Error` if unable to complete the close the operation

clients.name: Client
clients.description:
The client provides the capability to publish messages to the NATS server.
The `nats:Client` needs the nats url to be initialized.

`()` or else a `nats:Error` upon failure to register the listener
`()` or else a `nats:Error` upon failure to detach the service

methods.name: detach
methods.description: Stops consuming messages and detaches the service from the `nats:Listener`.

returnParameters.description: `()` or else a `nats:Error` upon failure to start the listener
`()` or else a `nats:Error` upon failure to stop the listener

otherMethods.name: detach
otherMethods.description: Stops consuming messages and detaches the service from the `nats:Listener`.

listeners.name: Listener
listeners.description:
Represents the NATS server connection to which a subscription service should be bound in order to
receive messages of the corresponding subscription.

annotations.name: ServiceConfig
annotations.description: The annotation, which is used to configure the basic subscription.

errors.name: Error
errors.description: The union of the NATS module related errors.

errors.name: NatsError
errors.description: Represents the NATS module related errors.
